content:
Join the ACT DIrectory! Put down your information and how you want to interact with the community, and use it to find other people for interactions.

The ACT Directory is part of a broader project to empower the ACT community. If you have ideas about this, would like more information, or would like to join the project, contact me or @Christian Williams.

@everyone
If you're wondering whether you're a part of the ACT community: yes you are!
Join the ACT Directory and use it to learn and connect with everyone. (and provide feedback here.) Thanks!

So far people are coming to look and being too shy to write.
Don't overthink it! Just add your name and put some info we should know. You can always edit later.
I added some stuff. I don't know what I'm offering or seeking. (I'm seeking more time to sit around and think....)
Thanks for adding your info! BTW, you're totally free to structure your entry however you want and say whatever you want, don't feel bound by "offering" and "seeking"
It would help if there was a bit more advice as to how to add en entry.
I copied/pasted the one above and changed the letters. This doesn't seem to break the bookmark thingy.

Timothy Porter said:

It would help if there was a bit more advice as to how to add en entry.

Sure, what would you like to know?
This seems like a nice idea, but is a big Google Doc really an appropriate substitute for some kind of database?
This is the informal version; it will be converted into a database eventually :joy:

Nick Hu said:

This seems like a nice idea, but is a big Google Doc really an appropriate substitute for some kind of database?

Yeah that's the idea, but we want to do it this way first so we can see how people actually like to use it, so we can build functionality into the database that people care about and not functionality that people don't care about. See the Sketch of Vision
Hi @Timothy Porter! I cut-and-pasted someone else's entry and then changed all the details.

It was the obvious thing to do, but it did not occur to me! :frown:
Tim
glad more people are starting to add! yes, we know a google doc is an informal way to start this. we are envisioning a larger project and we're happy to discuss it with anyone.
also, please keep entries alphabetical by last name.
whenever I open the sidebar and click on someone's bookmark, the sidebar goes halfway back out and I can't use it or close/open it any more. is anyone else having this glitch?
How do you have that ribbon like sign at the right side of your name in the doc?
Nevermind. Got it.

Christian Williams said:

also, please keep entries alphabetical by last name.

hi @Christian, some of us have unwieldy names: in Portuguese I'd put myself under P, but in English, I sometimes go under D. Do you have preferences? (it sometimes breaks things to have a space like "de Paiva".)
oh, whichever you would do naturally is good!

Great to see that so many people have added their information to the directory! I'm curious about two things:

  • Have you made any connections through the directory?
  • What features do you find most lacking in this initial version?
